blogs.title: How to Choose the Right MVP Development Company (2026 Guide)
blogs.metaTitle: MVP Development Company | Build Your MVP in 6–8 Weeks | Kunamix
blogs.metaDescription: Looking for an MVP development company? Learn what it costs, the best tech stack, and how to pick the right partner to launch your product fast. Free consultation.
blogs.author: Kunal Kumar
blogs.authorTitle: Founder & Full-Stack Developer, Kunamix Digital Solutions

content.intro: You have an idea. You've validated it with a few potential users. Now you need to build it — fast, lean, and without burning your entire budget. That's exactly what an MVP is for. But here's the problem most founders face: they don't know where to start, how much it'll cost, or how to choose the right development partner. In this guide, we break down everything you need to know about working with an MVP development company — from real cost numbers to the exact tech stack we recommend at Kunamix.

sections.heading: What Is an MVP and Why Does It Matter for Your Startup?
sections.body:
An MVP — Minimum Viable Product — is the simplest version of your product that solves one core problem for your target user. It's not a half-baked product. It's a strategic first version designed to validate your idea with real users before you invest heavily in full development.

Here's why it matters:

Most startups fail not because of bad ideas — but because they build too much, too soon. They spend 12 months and $30,000+ building a product that nobody wants. An MVP forces you to answer the most important question first: Will people actually use this?

With a well-built MVP, you can launch in 6–8 weeks, get real user feedback, attract early investors, and iterate based on data — not assumptions. That's the difference between a startup that survives and one that burns out before finding product-market fit.

sections.heading: Real MVP Development Cost: An Honest Breakdown
sections.body:
One of the biggest advantages of working with Kunamix is cost-efficiency without compromising quality. Here's a realistic cost breakdown based on MVP type:

**Simple Web App MVP (e.g., SaaS dashboard, booking platform)**
- Timeline: 4–6 weeks
- Cost: $1,800 – $5,000 (₹1.5L – ₹4L)
- Includes: UI/UX design, frontend, backend API, database, basic auth

**Mobile App MVP (Android or iOS)**
- Timeline: 6–10 weeks
- Cost: $3,500 – $10,000 (₹3L – ₹8L)
- Includes: React Native/Flutter app, REST API backend, push notifications, admin panel

**Full-Stack Product MVP (Web + Mobile + Admin)**
- Timeline: 8–14 weeks
- Cost: $7,000 – $18,000 (₹6L – ₹15L)
- Includes: Everything above + cloud deployment, analytics, CMS

**What affects the cost?**
The number of features you insist on including in v1 is the #1 cost driver. Every feature you defer to v2 saves you 20–30% in development time and cost. A good MVP development partner will push back on feature creep — that's a sign they respect your budget.

At Kunamix, we always start with a feature prioritization session before writing a single line of code. It saves our clients an average of $1,500–$2,500 in unnecessary early development.

sections.heading: The Best Tech Stack for Your MVP in 2026
sections.body:
Choosing the wrong tech stack is one of the most expensive mistakes a startup can make. Rebuilding your entire backend at scale because your original stack couldn't handle growth is a nightmare — and it happens more than you think.

Here's what we recommend at Kunamix for most MVP builds in 2026:

**Frontend: Next.js (React)**
Why: Fast, SEO-friendly, supports both static and dynamic pages, massive ecosystem. Perfect for web-based MVPs.

**Backend: Node.js + Express**
Why: JavaScript across the stack means faster development, easy to find developers, handles real-time features well.

**Database: PostgreSQL**
Why: Reliable, scalable, supports complex queries. Better than MongoDB for most structured data use cases.

**Mobile: React Native or Flutter**
Why: One codebase for Android and iOS. React Native if your web team uses React. Flutter if you need the best native-like performance.

**ORM: Prisma**
Why: Clean, type-safe database access. Reduces bugs significantly.

**Hosting: Vercel (frontend) + AWS or Railway (backend)**
Why: Vercel deployments are instant. AWS gives you room to scale without migrating later.

This stack is what powers most modern SaaS products globally. It's battle-tested, has strong community support, and will comfortably scale from 0 to 100,000 users without a full rewrite.

sections.heading: How to Choose the Right MVP Development Company
sections.body:
There are thousands of dev shops globally. Most will take your money and deliver average results. Here's how to separate the good from the rest:

**1. Check their actual code, not just their portfolio website**
Ask for a GitHub link or code sample. Any serious dev company should have public repos or be willing to share sanitized code samples. This tells you more than any case study.

**2. Do they have UI/UX capability in-house?**
Many dev companies outsource design — which creates communication gaps and delays. Your MVP needs design and development working together from day one.

**3. How do they handle feature scope?**
If a company just says 'yes' to everything you ask for — run. A good technical partner will challenge your feature list and help you cut it down to what truly matters for v1.

**4. What does their communication look like?**
You should get weekly progress updates, access to a staging environment, and a clear Git workflow. If they can't explain their process clearly, their code will reflect that.

**5. Do they offer post-launch support?**
Launching is not the finish line. Bugs happen. Users find edge cases. Make sure your partner offers at least 30–60 days of post-launch support.

At Kunamix, we include all of the above as standard — not as an upsell.

sections.heading: Why Startups Choose Kunamix for MVP Development
sections.body:
We built Kunamix for one reason: we were tired of seeing startups get burned by dev agencies that overpromised and underdelivered.

Here's what makes us different:

**We build for scale from day one.** Your MVP architecture is designed to grow — not to be thrown away when you hit 10,000 users.

**We're a product team, not a code factory.** We ask 'why' before we ask 'how'. Every feature we build has a reason behind it.

**Modern stack, clean code.** React, Next.js, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Flutter. No legacy frameworks. No spaghetti code. Full documentation delivered with every project.

**Transparent pricing, no surprises.** We scope every project with a detailed technical estimate before you commit to anything. What we quote is what you pay.

**Real projects delivered.** We've built ERP systems, café management platforms, hospital software, quiz platforms, and SaaS dashboards. Our GitHub shows the work.

We're not the biggest company in the room. We're the most invested one. Every client we take on gets our full attention — because we only work with founders we genuinely believe in.

If you're serious about building your MVP the right way, we'd love to talk.

content.conclusion: Building an MVP with the right development partner gives you a massive cost and speed advantage. The wrong company will give you a slow, unscalable product that costs twice as much to fix as it did to build. The right partner will challenge your assumptions, protect your budget, and deliver a product your users actually want to use. That's what we do at Kunamix.

blogs.title: Why Small Businesses Are Losing Money Without Custom ERP Software (Fix It in 90 Days)
blogs.metaTitle: Custom ERP Software for Small Business | 90-Day Delivery | Kunamix
blogs.metaDescription: Need custom ERP software for your small business? Kunamix builds scalable, affordable ERP systems delivered in 90 days. Book a free consultation today.
blogs.keyword: custom ERP software for small business
blogs.author: Kunal Kumar
blogs.authorTitle: Founder & Full-Stack Developer, Kunamix Digital Solutions

content.intro: You started your business with a vision. But somewhere between managing suppliers, tracking inventory, handling invoices, and following up with customers — you ended up managing spreadsheets instead of growth. Most small and medium businesses lose 15–30% of their operational efficiency to manual processes, data silos, and disconnected tools. The fix isn't hiring more people. It's smarter software. In this guide, we'll break down why custom ERP software is no longer a luxury for large enterprises — it's a growth lever for SMBs — and how you can have one built specifically for your business without burning your budget.

sections.heading: What Is ERP Software — And Why Off-the-Shelf Tools Aren't Enough
sections.body:
ERP stands for Enterprise Resource Planning. In simple terms, it's a single system that connects every part of your business: sales, inventory, HR, accounts, production, and customer management — all in one place.

But here's the problem with tools like Tally, Zoho, or SAP for SMBs:

- They're built for a generic business — not yours
- You end up paying for features you'll never use
- Customisation is expensive, slow, and often impossible
- Data still lives in multiple places — killing efficiency
- You depend on their update schedules, pricing, and uptime

What growing businesses actually need is a system that works exactly the way their operations work — not the other way around.

sections.heading: 5 Signs Your Business Desperately Needs Custom Software
sections.body:
If any of the following sound like your day-to-day reality, you're already losing money to manual processes.

**1. Your team lives in Excel sheets**
If your operations manager tracks inventory in a spreadsheet, your accountant reconciles data in another sheet, and your sales team manages leads in a third — your business is running on guesswork. One wrong formula, one deleted row, one outdated file — and you're flying blind.

**2. You can't see your business clearly in real time**
When a business owner can't answer 'What's our stock level right now?' or 'Which customers haven't paid in 30 days?' without calling three people — that's a data problem. And data problems cost money, always.

**3. You're manually doing things that should be automatic**
Sending payment reminders manually. Updating purchase orders by hand. Generating invoices one by one. If your team spends hours per week on tasks a system could do in seconds, your labour cost is being wasted on low-value work.

**4. You can't scale without chaos**
Your current process works for your current volume. But what happens when you double your orders, add a new location, or onboard 10 more staff? If the honest answer is 'it breaks down' — you need a system that scales with you.

**5. You've outgrown your current software**
You started with a basic tool when the business was small. Now it's becoming a bottleneck. Limitations in reporting, user access, integrations, or workflows are slowing your team down every single day.

sections.heading: What Custom ERP Software Actually Does for Your Business
sections.body:
A well-built custom ERP replaces the patchwork of tools and manual processes with a unified, intelligent system. Here's what that looks like in practice:

- Inventory management — real-time tracking, low-stock alerts, purchase order automation
- Sales & CRM — pipeline visibility, follow-up reminders, customer history
- Accounts & billing — automated invoicing, payment tracking, tax-ready reporting
- HR & attendance — payroll automation, leave management, role-based access
- Production or service tracking — job cards, task assignment, milestone reporting
- Dashboard & analytics — live business metrics so you make decisions on data, not instinct

The result: Your team stops firefighting and starts executing. You stop guessing and start growing.

sections.heading: Why SMBs Are Choosing Custom Development Over SaaS Subscriptions
sections.body:
The subscription SaaS model sounds great — until you do the math.

A mid-sized business paying $200–$500/month on SaaS tools (CRM, ERP, payroll, invoicing, etc.) spends $2,400–$6,000 per year — on tools that still don't fully fit their workflow.

A custom ERP built by Kunamix typically costs a one-time investment of $3,000–$10,000 depending on complexity. You own it. You control it. You can modify it as your business evolves.

**SaaS vs Custom ERP — The Real Comparison:**

- Ownership: SaaS = rented tool | Custom = your asset
- Customisation: SaaS = limited | Custom = built for your exact workflow
- Cost over 3 years: SaaS subscriptions often cost MORE than a custom build
- Data control: SaaS = stored on their servers | Custom = your infrastructure
- Scalability: SaaS = their roadmap | Custom = your priorities

sections.heading: How Kunamix Builds Custom ERP for SMBs — Step by Step
sections.body:
We're not a generic software vendor. We're a product development team that builds software the way a technical co-founder would — from the ground up, for your business.

1. **Discovery Call (Free)** — We understand your current workflow, pain points, and goals. No sales pitch. Just honest technical consultation.

2. **Requirement Mapping** — We document exactly what the system needs to do, module by module, user by user.

3. **Design & Architecture** — Modern UI/UX design + scalable backend architecture using React, Node.js, and PostgreSQL.

4. **Agile Development** — We build in sprints. You see real progress every 2 weeks — not a finished product 6 months later.

5. **Testing & Deployment** — Thorough QA, UAT with your team, cloud deployment (AWS/Vercel), and a smooth go-live.

6. **Ongoing Support** — Bug fixes, feature additions, and technical support — we're your long-term tech partner, not a one-time vendor.

Average delivery time: 6–12 weeks depending on complexity. We've helped businesses go from Excel chaos to a fully operational ERP in under 90 days.

sections.heading: Common Questions SMB Owners Ask Before Investing in Custom Software
sections.body:
**'Can we start small and add features later?'**
Yes — and that's exactly how we recommend it. We build modular, scalable architecture from day one. Start with your core operations. Add CRM, analytics, or integrations as you grow. You're never locked in or forced to rebuild.

**'What if our team isn't technical?'**
That's exactly who we build for. Our interfaces are designed for operational teams — not engineers. We provide training, documentation, and ongoing support. If your staff can use WhatsApp, they can use your ERP.

**'How is this different from hiring a freelancer?'**
A freelancer is one person. If they go offline, your project stalls. We're a five-person team with developers, a designer, and a project manager. We follow Git-based workflows, write clean documented code, and provide a warranty on everything we build.

**'What does it actually cost?'**
We don't believe in opaque pricing. Most SMB ERPs from Kunamix range between $3,000 and $10,000 depending on the number of modules, users, and integrations. We provide a detailed estimate after the first discovery call — no commitment required.

content.conclusion: If your business is growing but your software is holding you back — this is the right time to fix it. Not next quarter. Now. The wrong software will keep costing you money every single month through inefficiency, errors, and wasted labour. The right system — built specifically for how your business works — pays for itself within months. That's what we build at Kunamix.

blogs.title: Why UK & US Agencies Are Quietly Outsourcing to White Label Development Companies in India (And How to Do It Right)
blogs.metaTitle: White Label Development Company India | Reliable Tech Partner | Kunamix
blogs.metaDescription: Looking for a white label development company in India? Kunamix delivers clean code, on-time delivery, and full NDA protection for UK & US agencies. Book a free call.
blogs.author: Kunal Kumar
blogs.authorTitle: Founder & Full-Stack Developer, Kunamix Digital Solutions

content.intro: You've built a successful agency. You have the clients, the relationships, the brand. But somewhere between closing a new project and delivering it on time — you hit a wall. Your in-house team is stretched. Hiring a senior full-stack developer in the UK or US costs $80,000–$120,000 per year. Freelancers miss deadlines and disappear mid-project. And your reputation is only as strong as your last delivery. This is exactly why hundreds of UK and US agencies are quietly building white label partnerships with development companies in India — without their clients ever knowing. Not because it's cheap. Because it's smart. In this guide, we'll break down how white label development actually works, what separates a reliable partner from a disaster, and what to look for before signing with anyone.

sections.heading: What Is White Label Development — And Why Agencies Use It
sections.body:
White label development means an external team builds the product — under your brand, with your client communication, as if your agency did it in-house. Your client sees your logo on the deliverable. They communicate with you. The development partner stays invisible.

Agencies use white label partnerships for three core reasons:

**1. Capacity without headcount**
You can take on 3x more projects without hiring 3x more developers. You scale revenue without scaling your payroll.

**2. Skill gaps**
Your agency is great at design or strategy. But a client needs a React Native mobile app with a Node.js backend and AWS deployment. Instead of saying no, you bring in a partner who specialises in exactly that.

**3. Margin protection**
A senior developer in London or New York costs $60–$100/hour. A senior full-stack team in India with equivalent skills costs $20–$35/hour. The work is the same. Your margin is not.

The model works — when you pick the right partner. The model fails — when you pick wrong.

sections.heading: Why Most White Label Partnerships Fall Apart (And Who's Left Holding the Bag)
sections.body:
Ask any agency owner who's had a bad outsourcing experience and you'll hear the same story.

**Missed deadlines with no warning.**
The partner goes quiet for two weeks. You're emailing daily. Your client is asking questions. You have nothing to say. The delivery slips by three weeks. You absorb the blame.

**Code you can't maintain or hand off.**
The project delivers. But when your next developer opens the codebase — no documentation, inconsistent naming, no version control, no comments. It's a black box. You've inherited someone else's technical debt.

**Communication that costs you sleep.**
Time zone gaps are real. But a good partner works around them. A bad partner uses them as an excuse. You're chasing updates at 11pm. Stand-up calls get cancelled. Promises are made and quietly dropped.

**No accountability when things go wrong.**
A freelancer disappears. An offshore agency says the scope changed. The NDA wasn't airtight. Suddenly your client's data, design assets, and IP are unprotected.

The problem isn't India. The problem is picking a vendor instead of a partner.

sections.heading: What a Reliable White Label Development Partner Actually Looks Like
sections.body:
Before you sign any agreement, here's the checklist that separates professional development companies from risky bets.

**✅ Git-based workflow**
Every commit tracked. Every change documented. You have full access to the repository at all times. If the relationship ends tomorrow, you have everything.

**✅ Clean, documented code**
Readme files. Inline comments. Consistent code standards. A developer you hire next year should be able to open the project and understand it within an hour.

**✅ NDA + IP assignment**
A professional partner signs an NDA before the discovery call. All IP created belongs to your agency — or your client. No ambiguity.

**✅ Transparent project management**
Weekly sprint reports. Shared Jira or Notion boards. You see exactly what was built, what's in progress, and what's next — without chasing.

**✅ Defined communication windows**
A good Indian development partner offers overlapping hours with UK/US time zones — typically 9am–1pm GMT or EST. Daily async updates via Slack or email. No radio silence.

**✅ A real team — not a solo freelancer**
If one person is your entire development partner, you are one personal emergency away from a missed deadline. Look for a company with at least a developer, a designer, and a project coordinator.

sections.heading: How Kunamix Works as a White Label Partner for UK & US Agencies
sections.body:
Kunamix is a full-stack product development company based in India, built specifically to serve agencies in the UK, US, Canada, and UAE as a silent development partner.

Here's exactly how we operate:

**What we build:**
- Web applications (React / Next.js)
- Mobile apps (React Native / Flutter for iOS & Android)
- Backend systems (Node.js / Express / PostgreSQL / MongoDB)
- SaaS products and dashboards
- Custom software, ERP, CRM, and booking systems
- UI/UX design from scratch

**How we protect your client relationship:**
- Full NDA signed before any project discussion
- We never contact your clients directly — all communication goes through you
- White label deliverables — no Kunamix branding anywhere in the product
- All IP is assigned to you at project completion

**How we keep you in control:**
- You get access to our project board from day one
- Weekly sprint demos — you see real progress, not just promises
- All code on GitHub under your organisation's account
- Complete technical documentation delivered with every project

**Our tech stack:**
React, Next.js, Node.js, Express, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, React Native, Flutter, Firebase, AWS, Vercel

**Our team:**
We're a 5-person team — full-stack developers, a UI/UX designer, and a project lead. Small enough to be agile. Structured enough to be reliable.

sections.heading: The Real Cost Comparison: In-House vs Freelancer vs White Label Partner
sections.body:
Let's be specific. A typical web application project — 10 weeks of development, React frontend + Node.js backend + admin dashboard.

**Option 1: Hire in-house (UK)**
- Senior developer salary: £65,000/year
- Employer NI + benefits: ~£10,000/year
- Time to hire: 4–8 weeks
- For a 10-week project: ~£14,000 + hiring cost + onboarding risk

**Option 2: Hire a freelancer**
- Rate: £400–£600/day in UK
- 10 weeks (50 days): £20,000–£30,000
- Risk: availability, quality, continuity

**Option 3: White Label with Kunamix**
- Fixed project pricing
- Typical equivalent project: $5,000–$12,000
- Includes: design, development, testing, deployment, documentation
- No hiring cost. No employment overhead. No continuity risk.

The math isn't close. And the risk profile is far better — because you have a team, a process, and accountability, not a single point of failure.

sections.heading: How to Start a White Label Partnership the Right Way
sections.body:
Most agencies make one of two mistakes when outsourcing: they rush in without due diligence, or they overthink it and never start.

Here's a simple framework to start right:

**Step 1: Start with a small, low-risk project**
Don't hand over your most important client's project first. Give the partner a contained internal project or a smaller client project. See how they communicate, how they handle blockers, and what their code quality actually looks like.

**Step 2: Evaluate the process, not just the output**
Anyone can show you a nice portfolio. What you're actually buying is their process. Are they proactive? Do they flag issues before they become problems? Do they ask the right questions at the start?

**Step 3: Lock down the legal framework early**
NDA. IP assignment clause. Confidentiality terms. These should be signed before you share a single wireframe or brief. A professional partner will have these ready — you shouldn't need to ask.

**Step 4: Define communication expectations upfront**
How often will you get updates? Which timezone hours overlap? What's the escalation path if something goes wrong? Get this in writing before the project starts.

**Step 5: Review the codebase before final payment**
Before you pay the final invoice — have a technical review of the code. Check for documentation, version control history, and test coverage. A partner who delivers clean, documented code is a partner worth keeping long-term.

sections.heading: Questions UK & US Agency Owners Ask Before Partnering
sections.body:
**'Will my clients find out you exist?'**
No. We operate entirely in the background. No Kunamix branding, no direct client communication, no mentions in code comments or documentation. From your client's perspective, your agency built everything.

**'What if the project is late?'**
We manage this proactively. If a sprint is at risk of slipping, we tell you in advance — not after. We'd rather have an uncomfortable conversation early than surprise you on a deadline. In our process, you always know exactly where the project stands.

**'Can we work on ongoing retainer?'**
Yes — and this is how our best agency relationships work. A monthly retainer gives you guaranteed capacity, priority scheduling, and a team that already knows your stack and standards. We offer flexible retainer models from 20 hours/month upward.

**'What happens to the code if we stop working together?'**
You keep everything. The repository is under your GitHub account from day one. All documentation is yours. There's no lock-in, no proprietary systems, no dependency on us to keep your product running.

**'How do we handle time zone differences?'**
We offer overlap windows with UK time (9am–2pm GMT) and US East Coast time (10am–3pm EST). Daily async updates via Slack. Weekly live calls via Zoom or Google Meet. Most agency partners tell us our communication is better than developers they've worked with locally.

content.conclusion: The agencies winning right now aren't necessarily the ones with the biggest in-house teams. They're the ones who've figured out how to deliver more, faster, without proportionally increasing their costs or risk. A white label development partner in India — the right one — is how they're doing it. Not because it's a shortcut. Because it's a smarter way to build. At Kunamix, we've built our entire operation around being the kind of technical partner an agency can trust quietly, long-term, and without second-guessing. If that's what you're looking for, let's talk.
